name: Whitelines Graph Paper Template
description:
This is a template for achieving 'ghost grid' graph paper inspired by Edward Tufte and Whitelines notebooks.


Many of us use graph paper for writing, diagrams, or artwork, and the grid is there to help us keep our lines straight and proportional. However, regular graph paper generally suffers from two issues:


  1. The grid lines are dark enough to distract the user by calling attention to themselves.
  2. The grid lines show up when the paper is scanned or copied.


This template minimizes distraction by using white gridlines against a 4% black background. The gridlines will not interfere with your writing or artwork, nor will they appear when the page is scanned or copied.
